abstract>p: Disclosed herein is a method and apparatus of immobilizing a biocatalyst on a microfluidic biochip for conducting reactions in the presence of electroosmotic flow. The biochip includes a polymer on its microfluidic flow surfaces
us-parties>inventors: wherein the polymer includes a first substituent selected from ionic groups of the same polarity or precursors thereof
?Something?: a second substituent that is a hydrophobic group
application-reference>document-id>doc-nu: and a third substituent comprising an immobilized biocatalyst- or precursor thereof. The biochip can be used to conduct multiple sequential biocatalyzed reactions in the presence of electroosmotic flow.

abstract>p: Systems and methods for monitoring analytes in real time using integrated chromatography systems and devices. Integrated microfluidic liquid chromatography devices and systems include multiple separation columns integrated into a single substrate. Using such a device
us-parties>inventors: parallel analysis of multiple samples can be performed simultaneously and/or sequential analysis of a single sample can be performed simultaneously on a single chip or substrate. The devices and systems are well suited for use in high pressure liquid chromatography (HPLC) applications. HPLC chips and devices including embedded parylene channels can be fabricated using a single mask process.

abstract>p: A new class of materials for use in electric and electroluminescent devices having one or more phosphine oxide moieties bonded by single bonds to two outer groups. In embodiments having two or more phosphine oxide moieties
us-parties>inventors: the two or more phosphine oxide moieties are further joined by a bridging group. By selecting appropriate bridging and outer groups
?Something?: the new class of materials of the present invention enables designers to “tune” the electrical and electroluminescent characteristics of the materials. The phosphine oxide moiety restricts electron conjugation between the bridging and outer groups
application-reference>document-id>doc-nu: isolating the bridging and outer groups from each other
pct-or-regional-filing-data>document-id>: and allowing the photophysical properties of the bridging and outer groups to be maintained in the molecule. The lowest energy component (bridging group or particular outer group) thus defines the triplet state
highest occupied molecular orbital and lowest unoccupied molecular energies for the entire molecule.

abstract>p: This invention presents a process to produce bulk quantities of nanowires of a variety of semiconductor materials. Large liquid gallium drops are used as sinks for the gas phase solute
us-parties>inventors: generated in-situ facilitated by microwave plasma. To grow silicon nanowires for example
?Something?: a silicon substrate covered with gallium droplets is exposed to a microwave plasma containing atomic hydrogen. A range of process parameters such as microwave power
pct-or-regional-filing-data>document-id>: were used to synthesize silicon nanowires as small as 4 nm (nanometers) in diameter and several micrometers long. As opposed to the present technology
pct-or-regional-filing-data>us-371c124-d: the instant technique does not require creation of quantum sized liquid metal droplets to synthesize nanowires. In addition
pct-or-regional-publishing-data>document: it offers advantages such as lower growth temperature
better control over size and size distribution
related-publication>document-id>doc-numb: better control over the composition and purity of the nanowires.

abstract>p: The invention provides polypeptides and nucleic acids which identify and encode LaeA
us-parties>inventors: a regulator of fungal secondary metabolite production which exhibits global control over secondary metabolite biosynthetic gene clusters. The invention further provides expression vectors
application-reference>document-id>doc-nu: methods of increasing the production of secondary metabolites in an organism naturally producing a secondary metabolite or engineered to produce a secondary metabolite
pct-or-regional-filing-data>document-id>: and methods of identifying novel secondary metabolite biosynthesis gene clusters.
and benzothiazoles. Also disclosed are methods for making 4-substituted and 7-substituted indoles
?government interest: including those having the formulae. The methods include contacting a 4-substituted-6
column26: or benzothiazole compound with a vinyldiazo compound in the presence of a dirhodium catalyst.

abstract>p: Bis(salicylaldiminato)titanium complex with optionally substituted phenyl or cyclohexyl on nitrogen catalyzes highly syndiospecific polymerization of propylene. Syndiotactic polypropylene with defects of the type rmr having [rrrr] content greater than 0.70 and block copolymer containing block(s) of the syndiotactic polypropylene and block(s) of poly(ethylene-co-propylene) and/or poly(alpha-olefin-co-propylene) are obtained. Certain of the catalysts provide living polymerization. Living olefin polymers and olefin terminated oligomers and polymers are also products.

A dynamic memory compression architecture is disclosed which allows applications with working data sets exceeding the physical memory of an embedded system to still execute correctly. The dynamic memory compression architecture provides “on-the-fly” compression and decompression of the working data in a manner which is transparent to the user and which does not require special-purpose hardware. A new compression technique is also herein disclosed which is particularly advantageous when utilized with the above-mentioned dynamic memory compression architecture.
A method and apparatus are provided for combating malicious code. In one embodiment
us-parties>inventors: a method for combating malicious code in a network includes implementing a resource-limiting technique to slow a propagation of the malicious code and implementing a leap-ahead technique in parallel with the resource-limiting technique to defend against the malicious code reaching a full saturation potential in the network.

abstract>p: The present application provides  Brassica  INDEHISCENT1 (BIND) sequences.
